review: I love this place! Fries, wind and lemonade are bottomless! This RR is rely modern;there's a TV behind the mirror in the bathroom. The food is consistently good. There's local beer on tap. Btw, at this location if you hear a Toby Keith song you can buy a beer for a buck! (Money not the animal haha)

One of the slowest services I have ever experienced. It took over 25 minutes to receive our order. We arrived for lunch; the dining room was not crowded. When asked why our meals were taking so long our server said that the kitchen had to cook the corn. The image of the corn speaks volumes.  It is amazing it took that long. We hadn't asked for a refund or to speak to the manager. However the manager heard of our unhappiness. Without request or complaint she gave us complimentary cards for an appetizer or dessert. We really like Red Robin's menu.  Perhaps this was an off time. We will try again. We have hopes that service will be quicker next time.
Food's good, but wear long johns and a parka. Ridiculously cold with ceiling fans at full strength.  Everyone's wearing coats.  "Corporate dictates the thermostat temps" BS!
Worst service ever! Don't expect food fast, been there 2 times and took over a hour each time..and food was mediocre at best..

After having lunched at RR for years, today was my last time. Lousy service (I always sit at the bar) and charging $9 for the house chardonay.  Sad. I will miss the guacamole burger but there are at least 100 restaurants in this town with great burgers.

I am always willing to give anyone a second chance...but twice in the past month I have had issues with this restaurant!!! First time, my order was incorrect and no bread was provided with my salad...I was also charged a different amount than advertised on the website...I phoned the manager and he said that "corporate runs the website" and someone "should have checked my order"... So I gave them a second chance...once again, no bread provided with my salad and the 2nd salad that I ordered was advertised to have "black beans, cilantro and lime, as well as a cheesy enchilda"...none of which were on the salad...SOOO...the management OBVIOUSLY DOESN'T CARE ABOUT THEIR REPUTATION!!! Has made NO EFFORT to rectify their issues, therefore DOES NOT deserve me as a customer!!!

Can always count on Red Robin for a good black and blue burger with my sunny side egg added. Sweet potato fries are amazing~ kids friendly~ balloons at the door make them wanna come back again and again~ now if they can only not pop the balloons inside the car on the way home it would be ideal...but that never happens of course^^

Had to wait ten minutes when there were numerous tables available. One order was messed up, took 15 minutes to get a replacement meal. Everyone else at the table was finished before the other replacement meal arrived. They could have at least brought a side out, but did not. Very little apology. Food was ok, nothing to brag about.
Always worthy. Liked the cocktails! Food was slow to come out of the kitchen but  the quality is always dependable at Red Robin.

Pretty good. Service was good even though it was a busy holiday. Offered gluten free buns and took extra care to ensure fries were prepRed in a safe way. Slight mixup with the bar order but they made it right when I brought it up.

The food is consistently delicious. And the service is consistently poor. I don't know if they understaff but almost every time waiters do not check on us, fill our drinks, or be friendly. However the food is good!

I went to red robin about a month ago and had a horrible experience and yelped about it. I got a comment on my review apologizing and asking for my email address. So I gave it to them and received multiple emails from the company apologizing and offering a gift card for all of my troubles. I had the manager of the Billings store as well as a couple of people out of Missoula apologizing. I am overwhelmed how amazing they were. I got a gift card in the mail and was completely content with that, then got an email saying they have one waiting for me at the restaurant. They knew the people from Missoula had sent me one but still wanted to give me one! How great of them! When I went in the service was fantastic and food was so fresh!! Great job redeeming yourself Red Robin! I'm over the moon about my experience.

My family and I came in on a Sunday evening for dinner and waited several minutes for the two hostesses to figure out which table to put us at in their empty restaurant. Our waitress was very prompt and got the kids their food right away since they were hungry and getting restless. After our food came my husband took one bite of his onion rings and said they were disgusting then took a bite of his burger and found a BONE in the meat! I immediately told the waitress and she apologized and said she'd talk to the manager. The manager, who was apparently too busy to speak with us, waived the meal from our tab. While we appreciated not paying for food we couldn't even eat we did not appreciate the lack of professionalism. In the future, Manager, I'd suggest personally speaking with customers who have disputes instead of sending servers to do your dirty work.  We will never come back.

By my lonesome, I popped in for a quick dish. I sat at the bar. If service here were an animal, it would be a turtle. It literally took 10+ minutes for said drink slinger to pour me a Guinness. The lady that had came in after I did had a drink and her lunch order placed by the time I got my beer.  I had the BBQ chicken wrap and it was delicious. Fries were good and I like the feel of the new location.  I sat at the bar for an hour+ and it is covered in dirty dishes that have been there from the previous customers.  2 stars for the food and environment, -3 stars for the poor service.

The food was great as always. But our waitress was a joke. She kept disappearing, and didn't come by to check drink levels. When it came time to pay and leave, it took her a half hour to come pick up our cards. Her name is Joslyn by the way. And overall service at this location needs a major overhaul. Hostess was a crab and apparently doesn't understand that she/he is the first person you meet at a restaurant, and is pretty much required to smile and be friendly. I wouldn't go back to this Red Robin if it was the last place left to eat in Billings. Nothing against the food or the back of the house staff props to you guys.

As far as family friendly sit down restaurants go in Billings this place is fantastic. They are usually super busy on the weekends so prepare yourself for a little bit of a wait for a table. For a decent quality burger this is my kids favorite place to go. We have had excellent servers, two stand out in particular- Brian and Kyla. We celebrated our four year olds birthday here and Kyla was more than happy to arrange having happy birthday sung to her. Overall a great place to grab a bite and their prices are beyond fair for the quality of food!

This restaurant has gone down hill since moving to this new space. The management is absolutely horrible. Wait staff makes you feel like thier either in a hurry to get you out or don't check on you.  The food has gone down.... I loved eating there when we came up from WY,  but lately it's been dry, overdone and just gross. Even my kids were not impressed this last time. Will not be back.

Don't bother unless you have an hour or more to wait for your food to come out! The good thing is, you rarely have to pay full price since they end up taking a percentage off the bill because of their poor management. Otherwise good food and atmosphere but management needs to fix their kitchen issues!

Ordered a kids hamburger for my six year old daughter. She didn't eat but maybe two bites and told the server it was "too hard" (meaning overcooked) Our server said she would take it back and show the kitchen. I mistakenly assumed she would bring us a new kids burger. Instead, it was taken off our check. That's all well and good, but my daughter left without eating a meal and I had to feed her at home, which defeats the purpose of going out to dinner!  My husband asked for Cheddar cheese on his burger and it came with American cheese. For an $11 hamburger, I think you should be able to get the cheese the way you want it.   Overall, I'm less than impressed with this Red Robin. I know we will not be coming back

Food was great but it took 15 minutes for us to get a seat for two people and a baby. There were open tables but they hadn't been bussed yet. Unfortunate that it took 45 minutes for a salad and burger.

Don't bother until they work out their kinks. My friend and I waited 40 minutes to get our cold food and another 15 for them to microwave our stale, dry fries. Two tables got up and walked out because they were never waited on. Everyone around us was also upset and leaving with free gift cards like it was Christmas!

Very much enjoy the royal red Robin burger.  However,  mine came out Luke warm after 30 min wait.  Plus a crown &  7 drink was $5.25 with happy hr discount!  Ridiculous for happy hr!  Reg price was $6.50!!!  Won't go there again for a beverage.......  Very disappointed

Dependable and lately, good new monthly burger creations  and beer pairings. And tonight, awesome awesome service from our server Sharda.  She was fun, attentive, communicative and on top of everything.  Service like that is what will keep us coming back

My family and I come to Red Robin fairly regularly and we love the new location, the food is always good. For some reason tonight the service was horrible! Very unprofessional behavior and it took 45 minutes to get our dinner. Not the best we've had here. Will be back though!

My family and I are very divided on our review. We Love Red Robin food! We have eaten multiple kinds of burgers and all wonderful as well as fries and onion rings. We always encounter a terrible wait when we go. The frustration is that there are open tables throughout but no one is getting sat at them.The new location also does not allow children to sit in the bar area, so this limits seating for families. The new waiting area is extremely small and is not adequate for the amount of people that are waiting. Great food but needs better needs better front end service.
Good food nice staff between the music conversations can be difficult to hear your date. Over all not to bad
Football Game on tv was so loud we could not even have a conversation. When asked to have it turned down they actually turned it up.  Service was slow and rude.

You can't go wrong with a delicious burger from Red Robin and bottomless fries. Yum!  BBQ sauce and mayo mixed together = Campfire Sauce, it's legit, as well as they brought ranch sauce for dipping without my asking, excellent! The onion rings are super also. We were there during a busy lunch but our server was hustling! Good job RR.
Brand New Location Next door.  Outstanding on every level but very busy so go EARLY for lunch or dinner.

Good food and great service make this restaurant a favorite of mine for many years. The fact that it is about the same price as mcdonalds is a big plus.  The waiter, Devin, was exceptional we never had to ask for anything.

The hostess was a complete ditz and rather rude.  She just couldn't decide where to seat us when the place was half empty.  Took her over ten minutes to figure it out ....  other people were waiting as well.  When we were finally seated the server was highly attentive.  The food was delivered promptly and was delicious.

They sure are struggling at the new location. The last three times here have been a mess with our orders. The kitchen is really struggling. Management is really working hard to make it better though. My boyfriend and I were planning on never coming back after tonight's experience but Ty convinced us otherwise. He's a great manager who understands and we're thankful for that but really hope the kitchen can get it together during our next visit.

This place is awesome!!!..if you go you gotta try the turkey burger with pepper jack cheese and sautéed mushrooms!!!...you won't be sorry!!!...great waitress!!..made sure we always had drinks and enough fries!!..the only thing bad was our table was a little wobbly!!!..but great place to eat!!!

We always enjoy Red Robin. With a great selection of burgers, wraps and appetizers it has something for just about everyone. We really enjoy the whiskey river chicken wrap, it is amazing. Also, I tried one of the beer floats, with Sam Adams octoberfest I believe, it is fantastic. Service has always been good here and I love the decor, lots of local art pieces. The bar area has lots of tvs to watch a game while you eat and good music too. The weekend crowds can get kinda big, so expect a wait if you come in then.

Newer location, modern craft burger/bar feel. Light years better than the tacky old location. Quality has gone up, hope it stays after the honeymoon. Love the new signature sauces for fries. Try roasted green chili sauce! Strawberry freckled lemonade is a must. I go royal red robin w/ egg or if I want sweet I go Bonsai, grilled pineapple. Mmm

Went there last Friday specifically for fish n chips on a good tip from my friend who said this was the only place in town to get them.  So we went early like 11:30 am was seated right away to be honest I didnt even look at the menu and just ordered what I have been seeking in this town now for 2 yrs. some good fish n chips! They came fast enough and generous portion well being that they are 11.99 which is high for that but I have been craving them! The fish was great and the batter they were fried in was great for not getting to go to spuds in Seattle, the only qualm I had was wished the fries were hot they were warm and thats the only peeve I had can't say anything bout the waitress she was nice don't know what the other items taste like but can't go wrong with the f n c's!
The jalapeño cornmeal bun is VERY good!  Burger was flavorful & fries plentiful.  Great experience!

I've Been in town for a little over a month here in Billings I'm from California and only here for work. Being that things are so much different in Montana then back home I was pleased to find out that there was a "Red Robin" here me and my gf went and ate with our baby and it was very good the waitress was very patient, checked on us often, kept our drinks refilled, and the atmosphere was very clean including the restrooms. I ordered the blue cheese burger with endless fries for the first time it was well done just as I asked, and my girlfriends California chicken sandwich came out great as well the food was excellent, I'd definitely come back here before I leave and head back to California.
The meal was good.. Food delicious.  Inside and outside very clean and tidy.

Great food,  friendly employees,  and fun atmosphere. I've never had a complaint for this restaurant in 10+ years. I do however wish they served a little quicker. The kitchen looks small maybe they would have added more space to it when they did the remodel.
I like the new restaurant better than the old one-much more modern. The food is still good, service seems better and it's a good place to eat.
Great little family spot. Decent food if a bit on the salty side. A few good beers on tap. All in all a fair value for your dining dollar.

I haven't been to a Red Robins in a long time since we livedon the East Coast.  It just wasn't like i remebered it.  The burgers were okay nothing special.  The service was very slow.  We got seated right away and there was no wait there were tables open and it still took an hour to get our burgers.  We did not order appetitzers or anything just the burgers.  We drank like 3 rounds of pop before the food showed up and had to wait for that.  Will not  bother going to a red robins again.. Oh yeah did I mention that for 7 people eating burgers and only having pop the bil and tip were like $100.  I have better places to go for that money!

My friend chose this place, not me.  I have eaten at Red Robin in Denver a few times and find it awful.  I really don't care for chains, but some of my friends just love this place.  They tease me, saying I am a food snob.  I don't know what to call it, but I avoid chain restaurants as much as possible. So I met my friend- on time, with a smile on my face.  This particular friend has no idea this is the LAST place I would have chosen, especially since I am in Billings for such a short time. We were seated right away, unlike the CO Red Robin restaurants.  The server got our order and brought the drinks and food in a reasonable amount of time.  Of course I ordered one of the gazillion burgers they have on the menu... after struggling with which one, I asked the server which one I should get. I went with her suggestion.  She made a good choice for me.  Here is why I give this a third star:  The bun was totally different from the buns in CO.  I thought these mega-chains had to get their food from the same place, make it the same way, no exceptions.  This bun didn't fall apart, kept "in place" as I ate the huge burger; and the place wasn't jam packed with people in a hurry.  Ahhh, Montana.  I love you so. Wasn't the greatest burger on earth, or even close, but waaaayyy better than the other Red Robins I've been to in the past.  I also thought it was so cute when one of the staff brought a balloon for a cute-as-a-bug kid in the other booth.  They even asked him what color of balloon he wanted.  He said green.  I thought it was a great choice.

I brought a friend from MIT home to Montana with me over thanksgiving vacation one year, and this was her favorite place we went the entire time.  The burgers WILL kill you from unhealthiness (examples:  guacamole, bacon, and cheese burger, egg, bacon, and cheese burger, onion ring, cheese, bacon, and mayonaise burger, ingredient 1, ingredient 2, and bacon burger), but you will die happy from deliciousness.
